intro: Boltonia ravenelii, commonly known as the swamp false aster, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, exhibiting a tall, upright stem that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces showy, white to pale purple composite flower heads in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, with a rough texture. Boltonia ravenelii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
